text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

text: The beginning of wisdom is found in doubting; by doubting we come to the question, and by seeking we may come upon the truth.
author: Pierre Abelard

text: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: The wise find pleasure in water; the virtuous find pleasure in hills.
author: Confucius

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

text: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

text: The wise man doesn't give the right answers, he poses the right questions.
author: Claude Levi-Strauss

text: Wisdom is not wisdom when it is derived from books alone.
author: Horace

text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
author: Voltaire

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
author: Bruce Lee

text: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
author: Rumi
